description: Facts and certain transport-related documents about the London Borough of Tower Hamlets

texts: {"template":"intro","texts":["We partner with Tower Hamlets to implement the Mayor's Transport Strategy in the borough."],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP)"}

The LIP is produced by the London Borough of Tower Hamlets and agreed with us. It sets out the details on transport infrastructure changes in a three-year period to support the Mayor's Transport Strategy .

{"template":"listgroup","style":"nocard","links":[{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) allocation 2019/20","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/tower-hamlets-2019-20-lip-allocation-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 219KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2017/18 - Borough Leader","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/1718-lip-confirmation-leader-letter-tower-hamlets.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 59KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) confirmation letter 2016/17","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/lip-funding-confirmation-letters-16-17-tower-hamlets.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 61KB","image":{}},{"title":"Local Implementation Plan (LIP) delivery plan letter","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/tower-hamlets-lip-delivery-plan-letter.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 70KB","image":{}},{"title":"Public Transport Access Levels - Tower Hamlets","url":"/cdn/static/cms/documents/public-transport-access-levels-tower-hamlets.pdf","icon":"download","size":"PDF 2.78MB","image":{}}],"link":{"image":{}},"image":{},"wrapped":false}
Find out more about LIP funding.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"LIP targets for Tower Hamlets"}
Each borough has set targets in their LIP against the Mayor's Transport Strategy outcomes - we track and report on progress against these targets in the LIP3 MTS outcomes borough data pack .
For example, the car ownership in the borough was 46,694 in 2017. The LIP target to reduce car ownership by 2021 is 41,400.
Residents in Tower Hamlets made an average of 545,000 trips each day between 2015 and 2018 by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Car and motorcycle: 18%","Tube/DLR: 19%","National Rail and London Overground: 3%","Bus/Tram: 15%","Taxi/Other: 2%","Cycle: 4%","Walking: 39%"]}
We also work with boroughs to encourage more cycling . We recorded 24,521 daily cycle trips on average starting in Tower Hamlets between 2015 and 2018.
More resident and visitor population figures are on the GLA website.
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"Funding for your borough"}
We provide funding to boroughs and local communities for transport improvements in your local area.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Vision Zero"}

We are working with boroughs to reduce the number of deaths and serious injuries from all road collisions to zero by 2041. They are responsible for enforcing safe speeds on their roads, as well as leading community programmes to encourage using roads safely. Find out more about Vision Zero .
In 2017 there were 187 individuals killed or seriously injured in Tower Hamlets. Our target for 2022 is to reduce this number to 45.
Find out more about collisions in your borough.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"What we're working on in Tower Hamlets"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["We consult local communities on a range of projects every year - \u003ca href=\"https://consultations.tfl.gov.uk/consultation_finder/?advanced=1\u0026st=open\"\u003esearch the TfL Consultation Hub\u003c/a\u003e ","Find out about \u003ca href=\"/status-updates/major-works-and-events\"\u003emajor works and events near you\u003c/a\u003e ","See some ongoing TfL \u003ca href=\"http://www.tfl.gov.uk/travel-information/improvements-and-projects/?Borough=Tower Hamlets\"\u003eimprovements and projects in or near Tower Hamlets\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Work now going on in your borough includes:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eA13 Commercial Road\u003c/strong\u003e - safety improvements between New Road and Jubilee Street would reduce danger for vulnerable road users and encourage walking and cycling","\u003cstrong\u003ea\u003c/strong\u003e - a new river crossing would allow people walking and cycling to cross safely","\u003cstrong\u003ea\u003c/strong\u003e - we're buying a new fleet of walkthrough DLR trains","\u003cstrong\u003ea\u003c/strong\u003e - Whitechapel High Street improvements include better lighting along the market, new stall coverings, wayfinding signs, enhanced seating and investigating the repair of the existing water fountain by the station. We have already made signage and parking bay regulations for loading and unloading clearer and more enforceable to help blue badge holders park in these bays"]}
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Bus network changes"}
From time to time - after consulting the public - we alter bus routes to reflect changing patterns in demand. We also make temporary changes, often because of road works. See the latest bus changes.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Ultra Low Emission Zone (ULEZ)"}
To improve air quality the ULEZ will extend to Tower Hamlets from October 2021 .
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Our assets in Tower Hamlets"}
Assets we maintain in your borough include:

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Nine Tube stations","Two Elizabeth line stations","Five London Overground stations","17 DLR stations","Around 430 bus stops - \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/maps_/bus-spider-maps?Query=Tower Hamlets\"\u003esee all 34 day bus routes in Tower Hamlets\u003c/a\u003e ","One bus station","One coach station","One TfL pier (Tower)","Cycle Superhighway 2 which runs from Stratford to Aldgate","Three taxi ranks","Around 240 traffic signals","Over 27 kilometres of \u003ca href=\"https://tfl.gov.uk/modes/driving/red-routes/red-route-maps\"\u003ered routes\u003c/a\u003e "]}
See a map of our assets in London.
We maintain our assets until they need to be renewed or disposed of as set out in our asset management plan. We do this by:
{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Servicing them regularly to keep them operational","Repairing or replacing faulty assets"]}
Report a problem on a London street with our Streetcare tool .
{"template":"htag","level":"h4","value":"We do not maintain in Tower Hamlets:"}

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["Non-red route roads - these are maintained by \u003ca href=\"https://www.towerhamlets.gov.uk/Home.aspx\"\u003eTower Hamlets\u003c/a\u003e ","Litter removal on red routes - this is also the borough's responsibility","Network Rail track at London Overground stations - \u003ca href=\"https://www.networkrail.co.uk/communities/contact-us/\"\u003econtact Network Rail.\u003c/a\u003e Track and signals between Shoreditch High Street and Wapping is owned and maintained by us","Taxis and mini cabs - these are owned by \u003ca href=\"/modes/taxis-and-minicabs/what-to-expect-from-your-journey\"\u003etaxi drivers and minicab offices \u003c/a\u003e ","Coaches","Four bus garages in Tower Hamlets that are \u003ca href=\"/modes/buses/who-runs-your-bus\"\u003eowned and managed by bus companies\u003c/a\u003e "," \u003ca href=\"/info-for/taxis-and-private-hire/taxi-ranks\"\u003eTaxi ranks\u003c/a\u003e on borough roads. Cars and other vehicles parked on taxi ranks can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.towerhamlets.gov.uk/lgnl/transport_and_streets/Parking/Parking.aspx\"\u003ereported to Tower Hamlets\u003c/a\u003e "]}
Report private hire vehicles (PHVs) parked on ranks or unattended taxis on ranks directly to us.
{"template":"htag","level":"h3","value":"Dealing with severe weather"}
For documents relating to winter service in the boroughs, go to the Streets publications page .
